description: Uploaded by https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/runbooks/-/jobs/2246123362 at Thu Mar 24 14:27:10 UTC 2022

panels.description: Error rates are a measure of unhandled service exceptions per second. Client errors are excluded when possible. Lower is better

seriesOverrides.alias: 6h Degradation SLO (5% of monthly error budget)
1h Outage SLO (2% of monthly error budget)

targets.legendFormat: 6h Degradation SLO (5% of monthly error budget)
1h Outage SLO (2% of monthly error budget)

panels.title: kas Service Error Ratio

targets.expr:
sum (
  label_replace(
    vector(0) and on() (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_1h{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="kas"}),
    "period", "na", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(1) and on() (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_5m{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="kas"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (14.4 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{component="",monitor="global",type="kas"})),
    "period", "5m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(2) and on() (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_1h{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="kas"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (14.4 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{component="",monitor="global",type="kas"})),
    "period", "1h", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(4) and on() (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_30m{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="kas"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (6 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{component="",monitor="global",type="kas"})),
    "period", "30m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(8) and on() (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_6h{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="kas"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (6 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{component="",monitor="global",type="kas"})),
    "period", "6h", "", ""
  )
)

panels.description: The operation rate is the sum total of all requests being handle for all components within this service. Note that a single user request can lead to requests to multiple components. Higher is busier.
panels.title: kas Service RPS - Requests per Second

panels.description: Saturation is a measure of what ratio of a finite resource is currently being utilized. Lower is better.
panels.title: Saturation

panels.title: grpc_requests SLI Error Ratio

targets.expr:
sum (
  label_replace(
    vector(0) and on() (gitlab_component_errors:ratio_1h{component="grpc_requests",env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="kas"}),
    "period", "na", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(1) and on() (gitlab_component_errors:ratio_5m{component="grpc_requests",env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="kas"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (14.4 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{component="grpc_requests",monitor="global",type="kas"})),
    "period", "5m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(2) and on() (gitlab_component_errors:ratio_1h{component="grpc_requests",env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="kas"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (14.4 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{component="grpc_requests",monitor="global",type="kas"})),
    "period", "1h", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(4) and on() (gitlab_component_errors:ratio_30m{component="grpc_requests",env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="kas"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (6 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{component="grpc_requests",monitor="global",type="kas"})),
    "period", "30m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(8) and on() (gitlab_component_errors:ratio_6h{component="grpc_requests",env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="kas"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (6 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{component="grpc_requests",monitor="global",type="kas"})),
    "period", "6h", "", ""
  )
)

panels.content:
### Observability Tools

* [ðŸž Sentry Releases: gitlab/kas](https://sentry.gitlab.net/gitlab/kas/releases?environment=${environment})
* [ðŸž Sentry issues](https://sentry.gitlab.net/gitlab/kas/issues?environment=${environment})
* [ðŸ“– Kibana: Kubernetes Agent Server logs](https://log.gprd.gitlab.net/app/kibana#/discover?_a=(columns:!(json.msg,json.project_id,json.commit_id,json.number_of_files,json.grpc.time_ms),filters:!((meta:(key:json.type.keyword,params:kas,type:phrase),query:(match:(json.type.keyword:(query:kas,type:phrase)))),(meta:(key:json.stage,params:'$stage',type:phrase),query:(match:(json.stage:(query:'$stage',type:phrase)))),(meta:(key:json.type,params:kas,type:phrase),query:(match:(json.type:(query:kas,type:phrase))))),index:'78f49290-709e-11eb-b821-df2c3b5b1510')&_g=(time:(from:'${__from:date:iso}',to:'${__to:date:iso}')))
* [ðŸ“– Kibana: Kubernetes Agent Server failed request logs](https://log.gprd.gitlab.net/app/kibana#/discover?_a=(columns:!(json.msg,json.project_id,json.commit_id,json.number_of_files,json.grpc.time_ms),filters:!((meta:(key:json.type.keyword,params:kas,type:phrase),query:(match:(json.type.keyword:(query:kas,type:phrase)))),(meta:(key:json.stage,params:'$stage',type:phrase),query:(match:(json.stage:(query:'$stage',type:phrase)))),(meta:(key:json.type,params:kas,type:phrase),query:(match:(json.type:(query:kas,type:phrase)))),(meta:(key:exists,type:json.error,value:exists),query:(exists:(field:json.error)))),index:'78f49290-709e-11eb-b821-df2c3b5b1510')&_g=(time:(from:'${__from:date:iso}',to:'${__to:date:iso}')))
* [ðŸ“ˆ Kibana: Kubernetes Agent Server requests](https://log.gprd.gitlab.net/app/kibana#/visualize/create?type=line&indexPattern=78f49290-709e-11eb-b821-df2c3b5b1510&_a=(filters:!((meta:(key:json.type.keyword,params:kas,type:phrase),query:(match:(json.type.keyword:(query:kas,type:phrase)))),(meta:(key:json.stage,params:'$stage',type:phrase),query:(match:(json.stage:(query:'$stage',type:phrase)))),(meta:(key:json.type,params:kas,type:phrase),query:(match:(json.type:(query:kas,type:phrase))))),query:(language:kuery,query:''),vis:(aggs:!((enabled:!t,id:'1',params:(),schema:metric,type:count),(enabled:!t,id:'2',params:(drop_partials:!t,extended_bounds:(),field:json.time,interval:auto,min_doc_count:1,scaleMetricValues:!f,timeRange:(from:'${__from:date:iso}',to:'${__to:date:iso}'),useNormalizedEsInterval:!t),schema:segment,type:date_histogram))))&_g=(time:(from:'${__from:date:iso}',to:'${__to:date:iso}')))
* [ðŸ“ˆ Kibana: Kubernetes Agent Server failed requests](https://log.gprd.gitlab.net/app/kibana#/visualize/create?type=line&indexPattern=78f49290-709e-11eb-b821-df2c3b5b1510&_a=(filters:!((meta:(key:json.type.keyword,params:kas,type:phrase),query:(match:(json.type.keyword:(query:kas,type:phrase)))),(meta:(key:json.stage,params:'$stage',type:phrase),query:(match:(json.stage:(query:'$stage',type:phrase)))),(meta:(key:json.type,params:kas,type:phrase),query:(match:(json.type:(query:kas,type:phrase)))),(meta:(key:exists,type:json.error,value:exists),query:(exists:(field:json.error)))),query:(language:kuery,query:''),vis:(aggs:!((enabled:!t,id:'1',params:(),schema:metric,type:count),(enabled:!t,id:'2',params:(drop_partials:!t,extended_bounds:(),field:json.time,interval:auto,min_doc_count:1,scaleMetricValues:!f,timeRange:(from:'${__from:date:iso}',to:'${__to:date:iso}'),useNormalizedEsInterval:!t),schema:segment,type:date_histogram))))&_g=(time:(from:'${__from:date:iso}',to:'${__to:date:iso}')))
panels.title: Details

panels.description:
Ratio of requested CPU resources from allocatable resources.
Ideally we have requests utilization close to 100%. Values are
below 100% typically because pods do not fit well on nodes or
because we might be bound by memory requests already.
panels.title: Node CPU Requests Utilization

panels.description:
Ratio of requested Memory resources from allocatable resources.
Ideally we have requests utilization close to 100%. Values are
below 100% typically because pods do not fit well on nodes or
because we might be bound by CPU requests already.
panels.title: Node Memory Requests Utilization

panels.description:
Kubernetes containers are allocated a share of CPU. When this is exhausted, the container may be thottled.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, pod, container) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      sum by (environment, tier, type, stage, pod, container) (
        rate(container_cpu_usage_seconds_total:labeled{container!="", container!="POD", env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="kas"}[5m])
      )
      /
      sum by(environment, tier, type, stage, pod, container) (
        container_spec_cpu_quota:labeled{container!="", container!="POD", env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="kas"}
        /
        container_spec_cpu_period:labeled{container!="", container!="POD", env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="kas"}
      )
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: kube_container_cpu component saturation: Kube Container CPU Utilization

panels.description:
Records the total memory utilization for containers for this service, as a percentage of
the memory limit as configured through Kubernetes.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, pod, container) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      container_memory_working_set_bytes:labeled{container!="", container!="POD", env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="kas"}
      /
      (container_spec_memory_limit_bytes:labeled{container!="", container!="POD", env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="kas"} > 0)
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: kube_container_memory component saturation: Kube Container Memory Utilization

panels.description:
Measures Go memory usage as a percentage of container memory limit
 Lower is better.
panels.title: kube_go_memory component saturation: Go Memory Utilization per Node

panels.description:
The [Horizontal Pod Autoscaler](https://kubernetes.io/docs/tasks/run-application/horizontal-pod-autoscale/)
automatically scales the number of Pods in a deployment based on metrics.

The Horizontal Pod Autoscaler has a configured upper maximum. When this
limit is reached, the HPA will not increase the number of pods and other
resource saturation (eg, CPU, memory) may occur.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, horizontalpodautoscaler, shard) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      kube_horizontalpodautoscaler_status_desired_replicas:labeled{env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="kas", shard!~"database-throttled|elasticsearch|gitaly-throttled|imports|memory-bound|urgent-other"}
      /
      kube_horizontalpodautoscaler_spec_max_replicas:labeled{env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="kas", shard!~"database-throttled|elasticsearch|gitaly-throttled|imports|memory-bound|urgent-other"}
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: kube_horizontalpodautoscaler_desired_replicas component saturation: Horizontal Pod Autoscaler Desired Replicas

panels.description:
Open file descriptor utilization per instance.

Saturation on file descriptor limits may indicate a resource-descriptor leak in the application.

As a temporary fix, you may want to consider restarting the affected process.
 Lower is better.
panels.title: open_fds component saturation: Open file descriptor utilization per instance
